content:
the first number with index 1 : ok but I think it is a little too lua oriented (with starting index of array with 1)

For your solution in lua, you can use read "n" to read a number, instead using tonumber and spliting the line.
the result is more concise :p 

R=io.read l={R"n",R"n"}I=R"n"for i=3,I do l[i]=l[i-2]+l[i-1]end print(l[I])

In fact if you don't ask for the two first values, the code can be more concise :
R=io.read a=R"n"b=R"n"I=R"n"for i=3,I do a,b=b,a+b end print(b)
